intro: Kohautia attenuata, commonly known as the slender kohautia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Kohautia attenuata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
